fields.description:
If i go to my bank's website, I just type bofa.com and it automatically connects with https. Console should do the same; users should not be required to manually type https in the url to connect this way, please. 

Thanks!
fields.summary: I should not have to type https in front of my console URL to be connected securely

comments.body: [~jloza]: Dupe of GUI-883.  See the comments in GUI-883 re why we can't implement this.
We should look again for alternate options. This is a really annoying problem.

Excited for your first in progress bug!

 !men at work.jpg|thumbnail!
https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1531
There's still a redirect, or a rewrite as we have it now.  I can, however, add the STS header.  Is that all that is missing?
Yes, it should do it.
Perfect, [~rusvika], thanks.  Updated in PR.
[~ashamblin], what cloud should I point at to test this?

I'm pointing to latest 4.2 dev cloud:
a-02.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com

Any account should do.

UX review passed by screen share since I don't have NGINX set up locally. 

Did notice that when session.secure is set to false, and you type HTTPS and everything else is set up right, you get an error message that makes no sense. [~kgill] can you look at that and see what that message shoudl be saying? Should it say connect via HTTP instead of HTTPS and not the other way around? Please adjust that before merging this PR. Thanks!

[~jloza]: We have GUI-1565 open to track the misleading message when session.secure is set to false and HTTPS is requested.  Now that HTTPS is the default, we should probably escalate the priority of GUI-1565 and move it to the current sprint.
awesome, [~kgill], that helps! Will move that one into the sprint.
PR 1531 merged
[~ashamblin], I'm testing on a fresh auto-QA install at g-22-05.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com and get a redirect to https://localhost. What am I missing?

https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1544/files

Opened pull request to address small configuration change.  Nginx will allow the user to rewrite to hostname, which is more flexible than $server_name which is defined.  That being said, the user may wish to configure $server_name explicitly.  I wonder if this should be documented?
[~tvo], let's chat about possibly noting these configuration changes when you have a chance.
PR 1544 merged
[~ashamblin]:  I've noticed that this does not work when trying to access the console behind an ELB.  We probably want that to work as well.

This development has been ongoing.  I'd be interested in getting an ELB setup with the console to work thru this.  It may be that we're going to have to have cloud admins add their domains to their nginx configs.

where can I best test this issue?

ELB doesn't have the redirection feature and it's up to the application to do redirection. Probably people will have a fixed URL for the console and do CNAME map from the fixed name to console's ELB URL. If so, then they would modify the console's redirection rule using that fixed https URL.

Verified.  I tried to go to the console using http://<console-name> and was automatically redirected to https://<console-name>
{code}
